record.field: 1. What file is responsible for glueing everything together, explaining what the application consists of, what its main building blocks are, ext____?
2. Which piece of code used in Android is not open source?
3. Creating a UI (User Interface) in Android requires careful use of_____
4. Which among these are NOT a part of Android's native libraries?
5. Android tries hard to _____low-level components, such as the software stack, with interfaces so that vendor-specific code can be managed easily.
6. Which are the screen densities in Android?
7. Which component is not activated by an Intent?
8. What is the difference between Activity context and Application Context?
A. The Activity instance is tied to the lifecycle of the application, while the application instance is tied to the lifecycle of an Activity
B. The Activity instance is tied to the lifecycle of an Activity. while the application instance is tied to the lifecycle of the application
C. The Activity instance is tied to the lifecycle of the Activity, while the application instance is tied to the lifecycle of an application
D. The Activity instance is tied to the lifecycle of the Activity, while the application instance is tied to the lifecycle of an application
9. What are the indirect Direct subclasses of Services?
10. If you need your interface to work across different processes, you can create an interface for the service with a ________?
11. What is contained within the Layout xml file?
A. The permissions required by the app
B. The code which is compiled to run the app
C. The strings used in the app
D. Orientations and layouts that specify what the display looks like
12. What is the driving force behind an Android application and that ultimately gets converted into a Dalvik executable?
13. When developing for the Android OS, Java byte code is compiled into what?
14. What does the .apk extension stand for?
15. Status data will be exposed to the rest of the Android system via:
16. How does Google check for malicious software in the Android Market?
A. Users report malicious software to Google
B. Google employees verify each new app
C. A separate company monitors the Android Market for Google
D. Every new app is scanned by a virus scanner
17. What was Google's main business motivation for supporting Android?
A. To corner the mobile device application market for licensing purposes
B. To allow them to advertise more
C. To directly compete with the iPhone
D. To level the playing field for mobile devices
18. The ___________ file specifies the layout of your screen?
19. What was the first phone released that ran the Android OS?
20. What built-in database is Android shipped with?
21. Which of the following can be accomplished by using the TelephoneNumberUtil class?
A. Delete a phone number from the contacts in the phone device
B. Retrieve a phone number from the contacts in the phone device
C. Save a phone number to the contacts in the phone device
D. Format an international telephone number
22. Which of the following can be used to bind data from an SQL database to a ListView in an Android application?
23. Which of the following are UI elements that you can use in a window in an Android application?
24. Which of the following are valid features that you can request using requestWindowFeature?
25. Which of the following should be used to save the unsaved data and release resources being used by an Android application?
26. Which of the following is the parent class for the main application class in an Android application that has a user interface?
27. Immediate base class for activity and services.
28. Which of the following fields of the Message class should be used to store custom message codes about the Message?
29. Which of the following would you have to include in your project to use the SimpleAdapter class?
30. Which of the following function calls can be used to start a Service from your Android application?
